means: (1800年前)康沃尔人说的凯尔特语，考尼什（雏）鸡
（英国）康沃尔郡的，康沃尔人的

entry.def: Cornish means belonging or relating to the English county of Cornwall.

example.tran: 康沃尔崎岖不平的海岸

entry.def: The Cornish are the people of Cornwall.

entry.def: Cornish is a Celtic language that used to be spoken in Cornwall in Britain. There are no longer any native speakers of Cornish.

means.word_mean: 1. a Celtic language formerly spoken in Cornwall
2. English breed of compact domestic fowl; raised primarily to crossbreed to produce roasters
